title: Reptile-ownership : household penetration rates 2007 to 2013
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Penetration rates, with a total of 7 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely negative which exists from 2011 to 2013.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2007 to 2008.
Conversely, the next significant trend is slightly positive which exists from 2008 to 2009.
Similarly, the next significant trend is extremely negative which exists from 2009 to 2010.
But, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2010 to 2011.
gold: The statistic shows the household penetration rates for reptile-ownership in the United States from 2007 to 2013 . The household penetration rate for reptile-ownership amounted to about 2 percent in 2007 .
